job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: JOB DESCRIPTIONSite Reliability Engineer:As an Engineer in the Retail and Athlete Tools team, you will be passionate about maximum availability, observability, reliability, security, and performance of Client’sDigital Experiences in Stores and in our Digital call centers around the globe! You will build applications, tools, and automation using your technical skills to provide deep problem analysis, detect system faults or code defects, define, report, write and build observability processes for critical metrics, and partner up with product delivery teams to provide long term scalable solutions to production issues!We are looking for hardworking engineers who can bring the following:Ability to observe, diagnose, code, and test fixes for production issues quickly and efficientlyAbility to develop and drive real-time supervising solutions that provide transparency into site health and key performance indicatorsStrong communication skills are written and verbal with the ability to articulate issues and their impact(s), write concise runbooks, and give technical demo’sCapable of reporting and communicating metrics with an understanding of the business landscape and how site reliability influences our consumersWorking understanding of IT service management (Incident, Problem, Change and Knowledge management)Ability to work across teams (business and technical) to continuously analyze system performance, seek for avoidance/root-cause, and proactively identify areas in need of optimizationPassion for continuous learning, partnership, and teamworkQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or another relevant subject area1-2 years of professional experience in software development, testing, and/or DevOps engineering.Career:Design and development experience with microservice-based architecture in Java, Node.js, or similar language preferredDesign and development experience with front-end UI languages such as Javascript, React, Swift, or similar preferredExperience building, deploying, and supporting cloud-based systems in AWS preferredExperience with at least one database layer such as SQL, DynamoDb, Cassandra, etc.Understanding of basic network and infrastructure concepts such as DNS, Virtualization, LinuxExperience with Docker and/or Serverless patterns a plusExperience with observability monitoring tools such as Splunk, SignalFx, New Relic, or Catchpoint is a plusBackground with ITIL or Lean a plus.
